org.accada.ale.server
Class ALE

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.ale.server.ALE

public class ALE
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the application level events interface. All ale operations are executed by this class.

Author:
regli, sawielan, haennimi

Throws:

define

public static void define(java.lang.String specName,
                          org.accada.ale.xsd.ale.epcglobal.ECSpec spec)
                   throws org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.DuplicateNameExceptionResponse,
                          org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ECSpecValidationExceptionResponse,
                          org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ImplementationExceptionResponse
With this method an ec specification can be defined.

Parameters:
specName - of the ec specification
spec - to define
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.DuplicateNameException - if a ec specification with the same name is already defined
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ECSpecValidationException - if the ec specification is not valid
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ImplementationException - if an implementation exception occurs
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.DuplicateNameExceptionResponse
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ECSpecValidationExceptionResponse

Parameters:
specName - of the ec specification to undefine
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameException - if there is no ec specification with this name defined

subscribe

public static void subscribe(java.lang.String specName,
                             java.lang.String notificationURI)
                      throws org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse,
                             org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.InvalidURIExceptionResponse,
                             org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.DuplicateSubscriptionExceptionResponse
With this method a notification uri can be subscribed to a defined ec specification.

Parameters:
specName - of the ec specification
notificationURI - to subscribe
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameException - if there is no ec specification with the given name defined
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.InvalidURIException - if the specified notification uri is invalid
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.DuplicateSubscriptionException - if the same subscription is already done
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.InvalidURIExceptionResponse
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.DuplicateSubscriptionExceptionResponse

unsubscribe

public static void unsubscribe(java.lang.String specName,
                               java.lang.String notificationURI)
                        throws org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse,
                               org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchSubscriberExceptionResponse,
                               org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.InvalidURIExceptionResponse
With this method a notification uri can be unsubscribed from a defined ec specification.

Parameters:
specName - of the ec specification
notificationURI - to unsubscribe
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameException - if there is no ec specification with the given name defined
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchSubscriberException - if the specified notification uri is not subscribed to the ec specification.
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.InvalidURIException - if the specified notification uri is invalid
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchSubscriberExceptionResponse
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.InvalidURIExceptionResponse

poll

public static org.accada.ale.xsd.ale.epcglobal.ECReports poll(java.lang.String specName)
                                                       throws org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse
With this method a defined ec specification can be polled. Polling is the same as subscribe to a ec specification, waiting for one event cycle and then unsubscribe with the difference that the report is the result of the method instead of sending it to an uri.

Parameters:
specName - of the ec specification which schould be polled
Returns:
ec report of the next event cycle
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameException - if there is no ec specification with the given name defined
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse

immediate

public static org.accada.ale.xsd.ale.epcglobal.ECReports immediate(org.accada.ale.xsd.ale.epcglobal.ECSpec spec)
                                                            throws org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ECSpecValidationExceptionResponse,
                                                                   org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ImplementationExceptionResponse
With this method a undefined ec specifcation can be executed. It's the same as defining the ec specification, polling and undefining it afterwards.

Parameters:
spec - ec specification to execute
Returns:
ec report of the next event cycle
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ECSpecValidationException - if the ec specification is not valid
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ImplementationException - if an implementation exception occures
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ECSpecValidationExceptionResponse
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.ImplementationExceptionResponse

getSubscribers

public static java.lang.String[] getSubscribers(java.lang.String specName)
                                         throws org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse
This method returns all subscribers to a given ec specification name.

Parameters:
specName - of which the subscribers should be returned
Returns:
array of string with notification uris
Throws:
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameException - if there is no ec specification with the given name is defined
org.accada.ale.wsdl.ale.epcglobal.NoSuchNameExceptionResponse
